newsitem.title: USA: Boston U. gets offers for TV stations - report.
newsitem.headline: Boston U. gets offers for TV stations - report.

text.p: Boston University has received numerous offers for its television holdings but has refused them all, the Boston Globe reported Monday.

The University hired Lehman Brothers to shop around the holdings, which include WABU-TV Channel 68, which recently signed a three-year deal to broadcast the Boston Red Sox games, and its two satellite affiliates, Channel 68 spokesman Eric Goldstein told the Globe.
Goldstein said the University received several unsolicited offers to buy the holdings, and decided to hire Lehman only to find out how much they were worth and not to seek a new owner.
The University also owns WZBU-TV on Cape Cod and WNBU-TV in Concord, N.H.
